title: Visualize
text: Draw a diagram to illustrate what is happening.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the speed of the express train.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the speed of the express train. Let's call the speed of the express train x. Since the speed of the local train is 12 mph slower than the speed of the express train, the speed of the local train would be x-12.

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the distances two trains traveled are the same, and the distance equals $$speed time$$.

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speed of the trains by the time to get $$4x=5(x-12)$$.

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for x?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$4x=5(x-12)$$, we follow these steps: 4x=5x-60-->60=5x-4x-->x=60.
